guidanceItem.title: For Communication Between Servers, SSL is used When an Application Does Not Trust Other Applications on a Server
guidanceItem.content:
What to Check For

Ensure that SSL is used for communication between servers when an application does not trust other applications on a server.

How to Fix

If your servers are not inside a physically secure data center where the network eavesdropping threat is considered insignificant, you need to use an encrypted communication channel to protect data sent between servers. SSL and IPSec can both be used to help protect communication between servers by encrypting traffic.

  • Use SSL when you need granular channel protection for a particular application.
  • Use IPSec when you need protection for all applications and services running on a computer.

Adapted from Microsoft patterns & practices guidance.
